results.headline: Review: In ‘Lace Crater,’ Regretting That Tryst With a Ghost
results.summary_short: The feature film debt of the director Harrison Atkins, this film revisits the horror of metamorphosis in a lost weekend with millennial drollery.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Lace Crater

results.headline: Review: In ‘The Land,’ Fast Money Brings Friends Deep Trouble
results.summary_short: The drugs, unfortunately, belong to a kingpin who also runs a farm stand at a city market.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Land

results.headline: Review: ‘Miss Sharon Jones!’: The Shimmies and Shouts of a Survivor
results.summary_short: This documentary follows the soul singer through a diagnosis of pancreatic cancer, chemotherapy, recovery and musical rebirth.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Miss Sharon Jones!

results.headline: Review: In ‘Shelley,’ She’s Expecting. But What, Exactly?
results.summary_short: This Danish horror movie is long on atmosphere but short on details.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Shelley

results.headline: Review: ‘Bad Moms,’ a Comedy of Outrage Pegged to Smother Mothers
results.summary_short: The film is a funny, giddy, sentimental laugh-in from Jon Lucas and Scott Moore, who wrote the 2009 hit “The Hangover.”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Bad Moms

results.headline: Review: In ‘Jason Bourne,’ a Midlife Crisis for a Harried Former Assassin
results.summary_short: Matt Damon returns in a film in which geopolitics and technology are scaffolding for what is essentially a story about human resources challenges in a large bureaucracy.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Jason Bourne

results.display_title: Hieronymus Bosch: Touched by the Devil
results.headline: Review: Hieronymus Bosch, for Whom the Devil Was Always in the Details
results.summary_short: Pieter van Huystee’s new documentary chronicles the preparation for a historic museum show and the quest to authenticate several paintings as Bosch’s work.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Hieronymus Bosch: Touched by the Devil

results.headline: Review: In ‘Nerve,’ a Shy Girl Seduced by the Internet
results.summary_short: Tired of playing it safe, a high-school senior joins a reality-style online game that soon escalates into dangerous stunts.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Nerve

results.headline: Review: ‘Don’t Think Twice’: Mike Birbiglia’s Smart Comedy
results.summary_short: The movie follows an improv troupe and its members, who can be both supportive and catty.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Don’t Think Twice

results.headline: Review: ‘The Seventh Fire’ Explores Drug Abuse on an Indian Reservation
results.summary_short: A searing documentary that shows the bleak lives of two residents of Pine Point, an Ojibwe village in northern Minnesota.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Seventh Fire

results.headline: Review: All Aboard ‘Train to Busan’ for Zombie and Class Warfare
results.summary_short: Yeon Sang-ho’s film, set on a South Korean bullet train, pits passengers against the spastic undead.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Train to Busan

results.headline: Review: Warm Burst of Romantic Bliss in ‘Summertime’
results.summary_short: A film about the struggle for sexual freedom and women’s rights, and also about the power of region, class and custom in the lives of its characters.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Summertime

results.headline: Review: Avenging a Sister’s Death in ‘Fight Valley’
results.summary_short: A street-fighting crew from New Jersey called the Knock-Around Girls is the focus of this punch-drunk action drama.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Fight Valley

results.headline: Review: In ‘Hillary’s America,’ Dinesh D’Souza Warns of a Plan to ‘Steal’ the Country
results.summary_short: The conservative author’s film paints a forbidding portrait of Hillary Clinton and her fellow Democrats.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Hillary’s America

results.headline: Review: In ‘The Childhood of a Leader,’ a Monster Made, Not Born
results.summary_short: The movie, set in France just after World War I, follows a boy with problems and delivers a sense of foreboding.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Childhood of a Leader

results.headline: Review: In ‘Quitters,’ a Teenager as Sinister as Iago
results.summary_short: Noah Pritzker’s film stars Ben Konigsberg as a defiant son who moves out of his troubled family’s home and pursues an egotistic, amoral path.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Quitters

results.headline: Review: ‘For a Few Bullets,’ an Antic Race Through Plot Contrivance
results.summary_short: Set in China in 1940, the film depicts a pair of heroes trying to secure a rare treasure in manic chase scenes.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of For a Few Bullets

results.headline: Review: In ‘Lights Out’ an Invisible Friend Turns Malicious
results.summary_short: The director David F. Sandberg extracts maximum frights from a simple concept: an entity that appears in the dark and vanishes in the light.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Lights Out

results.headline: Review: In ‘Hooligan Sparrow,’ a Chinese Activist’s Hair-Raising Defiance of the State
results.summary_short: Nanfu Wang’s guerrilla-style documentary tracks Ye Haiyan’s struggle to win justice for sexually abused schoolgirls and others.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Hooligan Sparrow

results.headline: Review: ‘Don’t Worry Baby’ and a Case of Uncertain Paternity
results.summary_short: This mildly humorous Julian Branciforte film, fortified with veteran actors, centers on whether a photographer or his father is the parent of a young girl.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Don’t Worry Baby
